title: Amazing Care Home
body: My husband has just had three weeks Respite Care at South Bebside. He was so happy there, nothing was to much trouble for the wonderful staff - they are all so kind, caring & compassionate - the home is immaculate, so bright, cheerful & welcoming - thank you all for looking after my husband the way you did.

title: Great help
body:
Used the service a few times over the last few month for myself and children and have to say it’s very good. Im always impressed with the the staff that you have in both the reception and Clinical’s. Everyone is kind and caring and really all seem to go the extra mile to make you feel happy and well cared for. 
This being said it doesn’t look like there is enough funding being put into this surgery, the building is old and in need of renovation.And I’ve seen the reception staff doubling as cleaners more than once when there has been leaks or spills in the building. It also shares the building with a lot of other practices and things and I feel that with how many patients there in the waiting room it can sometimes be ridiculous, surely it would make more sense to have its own building?
 However This is a brilliant service that I think Leeds is very lucky to have, I hope it continues to grow and gets the credit it deserves:

title: Great practice
body: Iam registered with mathukias surgery for the last 9 years now. Their entire staff including reception and admin people are really well mannered, professional and courteous. Particularly, to whom I visited recently very caring and considerate doctor who gives proper time to all patient to explain issues and address their concerns in the  best possible manner. I strongly recommend this surgery to the people in that area as they would not be disappointed at all.

title: Care and Kindness
body: I was admitted to A&E from Horsham Hospital on the afternoon of February 5th because I had broken my ankle falling downstairs at home. The doctors explained what was going to be done, operated on me the next day and sent me home (with zimmer frame) 2 days later. I encountered a level of care, kindness and humour that was beyond price. Yesterday, I went back there for my follow-up appointment and, once again, the staff were brilliant....I can only say thank you as loudly and often as I can...you’re fantastic

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Fantastic, honestly
body: I'm from london and was up in the area visiting for the weekend. Unfortunately, I ran out of insulin. My friend from Blaydon brought me to the centre and I was expecting the usual four-hour wait that I am used to in London. First, a lovely receptionist took my details; within 10 minutes I saw a triage nurse and within five minutes a doctor. Five minutes after that, I left with a prescription for the insulin I needed. What a fantastic service and what lovely staff. Take a bow Blaydon, you deserve it

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Birth centre is excellent
body: I recommend anyone giving birth at the hospital to try out the birth centre. Excellent one to one care and amazing postnatal care with own room and on-suite bathroom. Midwives were soo caring and lovely and always on hand to help. Was not busy when I was there so probably also made the experience better . Just made my birth experience all the more positive. Defo recommend.

title: Poor service
body:
Tried to book a appointment beginning of month. the only day in the month i could not do. Thats the appointment date they gave me so spoke the expecting the next working day. No got three weeks later so into the next month.
On my appointment day my time was 9.00 am. The guy who was doing my scan wandered in at 9.40am half asleep
Really bad. Showing contempt for the people they are working for. Really bad practice. No wonder folks get angry.

title: Discrimination against people that work
body: Rediculas system to get appointment on the day they don't give you one with a gp ringing you back to see if you need to be seen Not everyone can take a phone call at work therefore you can not have an appointment this is discrimination

title: Not angry just disappointed.
body: Have been with this practice for a year since moving to the area. Not only have they never got my repeat prescription correct in the many attempts they’ve had but some staff think they have a degree in rudeness however that’s not surprising considering the seemingly high turnover of ill qualified staff. You call at 8am for them to have no appointments? Don’t know how they can advertise this practice as having one doctor? More like half a doctor since she’s never there. I enjoy going to gp + where the doctors treat you with dignity and respect. I cannot wait to leave this surgery.

title: Surgical Assessment Ward 16
body:
Dealt with quickly but then a 6 hour wait for blood test results on the most uncomfortable chairs and being told not to eat or drink.
Appreciate there are a lot of blood tests to do at the hospital but ....

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Not fit for purpose
body:
I have been with this surgery for over 20yrs, the last 2yrs there has been a drastic decline of overall service.
The staff are incompetent to say the least bar one gp, receptionist are abrupt and possibly overworked,  i do still expect them to have knowledge in their role, which none of them possess.
Never have i experienced such inefficient duty of care.
I waited over 3ks for them to even locate a letter i had hand delivered, one of the many times i enquired as to status, the receptionist told me quite clearly, it was not there, turns out she was looking at the wrong patient record, basic errors, that should not happen.
They ignore or are not capable of relaying information.
I requested a prescription for pain relief after my surgery, this was not done at all, i ended up buying meds over the counter.
I find it ridiculous that they do not hold basic nursing supplies. 
Now i notice repeat precriptions take 3days, routine turn over is 48hours.
The phone is constantly engaged, so no chance of getting to even book an appointment.
The "service" is totally unacceptable, and i can can tell any one reading this from experience, high turnover of front line staff, tells you the surgery is in trouble.
What they need to do is re instate a practice manager and reception supervisor.
I for one, will no longer stand for this and i am seeking to register with an alternative surgery asap.

title: Very Professional
body:
From the moment  l arrived the staff at all levels were friendly and reassuring . I was monitored throughout my stay and everybody answered my questions in a caring way.
Thanks also to the catering staff who supplied a fish pie which was very enjoyable .
Thank goodness for the NHS

title: Always happy with the service provided
body: My partner and I have been to the practice a couple of times since we moved here 3 years ago and we have been very grateful for the caring, prompt, dedicated and compassionate help we have both received.  If we had to move away, it would be one of the things we would like to take with us!  Everything makes you feel at ease, from the phone conversations (never rushed, always friendly) to the waiting room and most importantly the appointment.  Clear and researched advice on all topics, kind and friendly people.  Thank you.

title: Great experience
body:
Visited her on the advice of a Pharmacist. Entered the minor injuries unit and it seemed pretty busy. The receptionist was very helpful efficient. 

The nurses who looked after my daughter were outstanding. My daughter was quite poorly and there were responsive, efficient and talked to my daughter to make everything seem less scary. They really made me, who was a very worried mother, feel reassured and safe. I can’t thank you enough. You do an amazing job!

title: Excellent Practice
body: I am delighted to express my total satisfaction for all the medical care received from my GP and all the members of staff since more than ten years ago i have been with them! They have been helpful, caring, consistent, puntual and proferssional. I would like to thank all members of staff for their excellent performance and for taking good medical care of me.

title: Great practice
body:
The receptionist was very polite.
They answered me after only two calls and booked an appointment for me in one hour and a half after the call. 
The GP really did help me, she gave me a lot of information about the services that they provide for free as I asked about a gynecological problem that I have. She offered herself to visit me and tell me what day she worked to book an appointment. She made me feel that she was happy to help me, and unfortunately that's not something that I have experienced with the previous GP that I had when I lived in another area.

title: Consistently caring and helpful
body: My late husband and I have both had superb support and help during serious illnesses. Speedy appointments, excellent and expert treatment given.

author: Danmz93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff going above and beyond
body:
I'm writing this Care Opinion because I feel certain individuals should be recognised for their hard work  
Marios ORB Community Connector  
Stacey ORB Community Connector  
Lewis Phoenix Fitness  
I believe they have gone above and beyond what is expected of any individual. They are compliant with everybody's needs, their hard work is very much appreciated and they also meet the demands from a service user point of view.

author: Ar1
title: Cystic fibrosis
body: When visiting the cystic fibrosis ward we are always met with a friendly face. The staff there are always helpful and will answer any questions thoroughly. They go above and beyond the expectations. Thankyou for the wonderful job you do!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: uniformwk97
title: It makes me frustrated and provokes resentment
body: In the space of 12 months I have been under the care of three different doctors and, now, a nurse prescriber. Doctors don't stay, they all have a different care plan and it is never carried through. I have had three different counsellors, one having left through stress, one through inappropriate behaviour and, now, one who is incapable of remembering appointments. Test results are not communicated and, not entered on the system. The service does not take account of the fact that we live 5 miles from the chemist but have to go in daily, and 15 miles from the service. We are both pensioners, one of us is disabled. It makes me frustrated and provokes resentment. Policies are now being put in place that would have crossed red lines just 12 months ago, taking no account of individual needs.

title: Totally destroyed
body: I feel that if you have a mental health condition and under this service that we are fully passed the blame due to your own incompetence and I find this soul destroying in all fairness.  I feel strongly that once you have a label of a MH condition that should you raise concerns that all is covered carefully so that the patient gets 100% blame. I have had many positive things within your service but sadly and I mean severely sad/distressed inc my family that myself/witnessed also has received so much more negative experiences that has actually impacted myself to being triggered more. When a mh fighter feels they are not being listened to or heard it really is a huge concern and can cause a huge impact on their well being! I also appreciate that dealing with people that suffer must be difficult but we haven't chosen to have this horrendous illness and when poorly we sincerely don't mean any harm. Feeling very alone and so let down after so many things that haven't been addressed in the correct way. I will also thank to the very few that have followed correct procedures but I use the word FEW! I just hope that no one ever feels the way I do and my family also. From a very fair and a honest reviewer.

title: John radcliffe emergency
body:
First of all I would like to thank all staff for very kind attitude, attention, and top professional level. 

I have suggestions to improve discharging policy. I have broken arm after car accident. After ~ 4/5 hours in the department I was 3 times informed that there are no medical reason to stay here. The doctor created substantial emotional pressure. When I was changing the body position from horizontal to vertical I was trembling and sick.  
I had to leave leave department under the pressure. My wife was driving to home with speed 20 m/h as I was feeling very bad; I think it was consequences of drugs or shock after accident. We had to stop the car few times. In addition whole way to home I was shouting to relax and suppress the pain and sickness.

author: Faded
title: Anxiety
body:
I attempted suicide in Oct 2017 after many years of suffering anxiety.  
I was moved from the hospital to a Rethink Crisis house for 2 weeks.  
Then moved to St Annes Hostel Woodhouse eventually staying 18 months. Initially the hostels GP did not follow the psychiatrist's advice and no treatment was forthcoming.  
I moved out of the hostel into a council flat after just completing 18 weeks of CBT that enabled me to at least get out of my hostel flat. I was then referred to Sheffield Mind/Connect3 by St Annes.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: Goblin
title: I feel angry that my time has been wasted
body:
I attended for pre-open assessment in January 2020. On giving the staff nurse my list of medication, they said they needed to check if the HRT I was taking would need to be stopped. The staff nurse checked with someone and I was informed it didn't need to be stopped and to carry on taking it as normal.  
I turned up at TAS for my surgery in March 2020 and the surgeon told me I couldn't have my operation, as I should have stopped my HRT 6 weeks prior to surgery. I was sent away and will now not get my surgery for another 6 weeks.  
I feel utterly disappointed and angry that this should happen and wish this matter to be looked in to. I feel angry that my time has been wasted. I work for the NHS and my diary has been cleared for 2 weeks to accommodate my surgery. That is 2 weeks worth of patients who will have to wait for their tests all due to an incompetent service.

author: Kerry1990
title: DDH
body: My baby was found to have Developmental dysplasia of the hip (DDH) at her check. The team were amazing at explaining it although my self and my husband were initially really worried! She got put in a public harness for 5 weeks and was out of it and we’ve been told she’s totally back to normal! You get special trousers at shops such as marks and Spencer’s which make it easier also!

author: decemberjw68
title: Methadone reduction
body: The Orion centre are reducing my methadone at 5 ml a week without my consent

title: Caring and professional staff
body: I have been a patient at this surgery for over 20 years and would highly recommend it. The standard of care given by the doctors, nurses and phlebotomists is exceptional. I always feel as though I’ve been listened to and that I am being involved in the decision making around my care. The receptionists are always very polite and helpful when arranging appointments. Thank you to all the staff at the Bell street surgery-keep doing what you’re doing!

author: bracedk37
title: I do hope this facility remains open
body:
I was in Kelso Hospital twice – Christmas 2018 and September 2019 – after being transferred from hospital in Edinburgh.  
No dedicated nurse.  
Advantages of Kelso Hospital:  
• More personal  
• Close to family and friends  
Staff were attentive, caring and respectful. Privacy was respected which was much appreciated.  
Excellent physio and OT services were provided during my stay.  
General nursing staff were excellent.  
Food was good and varied (helpings very large)!  
Post Hospital attention and care from the Cheviot team was good.  
I do hope that the Kelso Hospital remains open in the future as it is necessary to have this facility for the local community.

title: Superb care
body: My teenage son was due his immunisations & was extremely anxious about the whole process, begging not to have them done at school after viewing immunisations done there. The wonderful nurse dealt with him calmly, explaining everything that was going to happen & also why the immunisations couldn't be given via a tablet! Something which had caused a huge amount of stress for him was made so very much easier by the compassionate way that the nurse handled the situation & we are extremely grateful to her for her care.

author: CB45
title: Large cut to my knee
body: I had gone to another hospital only to be told waiting time was less at the Queen Elizabeth in Glasgow. I went over there at 6: 30pm and was seen within 30 mins by a nurse called Karen who was fantastic. The whole team seem to have a great spirit and everyone made me feel very comfortable. An overall pleasurable experience considering the state of my knee. Thanks very much to all staff especially Karen

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Amazing practice
body:
I moved to Denton a couple of years ago and always, typically, had negative experiences with previous practices. I have a few health issues which have mostly been discovered by this practice. I have always managed to get an emergency appointment if needed after committing to calling first thing, the receptionists are super helpful and compassionate. If you show them respect, they help you with whatever you need.
I recently visited my GP for an issue which turned out to be extremely worrying and resulted in a referral to hospital to rule out anything sinister. I was taken seriously despite having obvious health anxiety. I am currently waiting on a specific diagnosis and which treatment to go with. It was caught early thanks to the vigilance of the staff, i had blood tests within the same week due to their blood test clinic every thursday and also seen a specialist within 2 weeks of the initial referral.
They do use locums at this practice and I have only ever had great experiences with them. I recommended this practice to family and friends. I really feel I have received gold standard care here.

author: Hippyhop
title: Double operation
body: I was admitted to Ward 2 at Grantham Hospital for a double operation on my hip just over three weeks ago. Ward 2 is great and a pleasure to be there. The nurses and every one are always accommodating. The Theatre staff were amazing and if you are offered a Spinal, go for it, what an experience it is, partly with it but also feeling like a few good G n T's have been had. My sincere thanks to all, especially Mr Shahid who re-built me and gave me the ability to walk again. After 18 months, this is a Godsend. 10/10 to Ward 2 again.

title: Poor and not enough carparking
body:
We could not find any carparking spaces within the Wythenshawe boundary, we tried for 40 minutes and was force to use the private carpark next to the staff carpark at the rear.
This carpark has a payment system of using your mobile phone to pay over the internet. Our signal was poor we could not even speak to the parking firm due to the poor signal. We were in the carpark for over the 10 minute charge time trying to contact the payment system or the office. When we left we were charged with an offence. Tried to appeal, what a waste of time that was.

author: lancebombardier
title: standard of care
body: I would like to report the exceptional standard of care that I have had from the rheumatology department in Gartnavel Hospital. I experienced the onset of this horrible condition a year ago and since then have been treated so well by all members of the team. I cannot speak highly enough of the professionalism that I have encountered from all with whom I have been involved and single out Maureen, the nurse practitioner, in particular for the empathic attitude. The consultants ....Professor Porter and Dr Bawa   and Dr Gupta ........have all been so patient in treating me and I   am humbled by all of their patience and attention to detail. Thank you so much. Even the staff at reception have shown me such kindness and care. Well done.

title: Very good practice
body: I will like to leave this review to thank the Doctors and staff who has been helping and supporting me with fantastic medical care. The lead doctor has been very caring, helpful, professional and understanding. I wanted to also thank the receptionists for prompt responses to  appointments and following things up for me.

title: Outstanding
body: I see so many reviews where people criticise but I was seen in a 15 minute appointment and felt like I was assessed thoroughly and above all listened to. The staff were polite and respectful. I felt understood. I can't fault them.

author: CarrieG
title: Positive homebirth experience
body:
I was lucky enough to have a lovely, relaxed pool homebirth on New Year’s Day.  
From the beginning of my pregnancy my midwife Katie was incredibly supportive of my homebirth plans and had even hoped to attend my birth even if she wasn’t on shift. She’s by far the best midwife I have ever had! 2 months on from my sons birth I’m still absolutely elated I was able to have the homebirth I wanted, it was made even more special by the lovely midwives, May and Mandy, that attended my sons birth. I had the most amazing, positive experience and cannot thank them enough. Jane took over from Mandy after my son arrived and allowed me to just lay on the sofa cuddling my newborn, she even tried to tidy up my house which was so lovely!! I think it’s such a shame the homebirth rates in Forth Valley are so low and I’d love to help change that. I’m really interested in starting a homebirth support group for expectant mums to get information and advice on homebirths. I’d love to hear if this is something that could be successful in Forth Valley.  
Thank you again for all of the help and support I have received!

author: Female patient
title: My recent admission
body: I was admitted as an emergency and had surgery for a fracture. The service has been absolutely amazing. I have been through A and E theatre recovery, two wards, physio xray and met several porters on my wheelchair trips. Everyone was beyond friendly and provided a brilliant professional service. I haven’t been in APH for many years and feel extremely pleased at the excellence of my local hospital

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Service
body: I like this practice very much. The staff and doctors are all good. Very helpful surgery and they do what they can to help.

title: Utter chaos simply because one GP is off sick
body: Why dont they have contingency plan for doctors going off sick?Other businesses do.aren't they bothered about letting down loads of patients been waiting 10 days to see that gp?being told by receptionist you have to now go to the back of the queue, wait another 10 days for an appointment is unacceptable! Sickness is bound to hit gps occasionally. what about scheduling an extra clinic with a locum the next day to pick up all those patients who have been 'bumped'?its not rocket science.yes, it costs money.maybe that's the problem for them, we're not worth it.this practice was terrific 35 years ago, 3 fulltime genuinely caring gps for half as many patients, home visits, same day appointments.it makes me cry.why keep taking on more patients when you have no slack in the system.other practices have sensibly closed their books.i feel as if i am in very unsafe hands.

title: Diabetic Education
body:
I was telephoned to attend a diabetic education day and 4 days later, and (having phoned every phone number and leaving messages) no one has called me to book me in. I have even tried the main number. 
The voicemail for booking in was unprofessional -  (a message from someone who was clearly walking in the wind and rain whilst recording it). I would expect better standards.

title: Terrible practice
body: After years of being a patient I have enough of this so called practice. Despite them claiming they work to 6.30, it took five weeks to arrange for a doctor to ring me back after 5pm with my test results and no one did. It has now taken over a week for them to deal with a repeat prescription and I am still waiting.

title: Unhelpful, zero empathy and no appointments
body: I contacted this surgery for an emergency appointment following my sister being diagnosed with a severe heart condition at the tender age of 30. I explained to the reception that this condition is hereditary and my counsin died at 22 yo from this and my auntie 33 yo. Its called LQT, which is a silent killer and usually people with it do not make it past 40 years old. Lakeroad offered me a GP appointment for two weeks time! I have also contacted the surgery today as I am severely stressed, depressed and have had recent thoughts of suicide, the receptionist made mme aware I wouldn't be offered an emergency appointment because I have been feeling this way for a while it isn't classed as an emergency even with my recent suicide thoughts. I feel very let down, even lower than I felt before and really upset. Where's the support? Where's the empathy? Where is the basic care???????

title: Unclean during Coronavirus
body: The Coronavirus is constantly in the news at the moment, with the NHS and PM advising everyone to be far more frequent and vigilant in washing their hands. However the ladies' toilet at this surgery today had no toilet paper and no soap. When I told the receptionist, she took in a toilet roll but twice ignored my comments about the lack of soap.

author: KesDee
title: Lack of care, just seem to want to get rid of me.
body:
I felt abandoned by them. I was reaching out for help. They referred me to an alcohol service, which took ages, who refused me because I wasn't drinking enough. They told me I could not get CBT because of drinking.  
Turning Point told me that was not true but it took so long to get referred. They do not return phone calls at all. They do not seem honest. I was told a member of staff was away on holiday according to one receptionist, and when I rang back five minutes later the same person is in the toilet according to another receptionist.  
They waste my time with appointments they don't turn up to. They refuse anything. I feel they do not give me any care are at all. This is not patient centred care. They have not shown any care for me as a patient at all.  
They just refer to useless group therapy which I cannot do anyway because it is so far away and as I have to work and it is far away I cannot do that anyway. It is useless. I would give them minus stars if I could. They caused me damage to me than good. They do not listen to anything. It is just signposting somewhere else.

readBy.name: Kent and Medway NHS and Social Care Partnership Trust

title: Good experience
body: I have never had a problem visiting this surgery and this visit was no different. Once one becomes used to the ways a GP surgery operates nowadays I find it works well for me. I was as usual treated politely and with respect in a friendly manner.

readBy.name: NHS Bristol, North Somerset and South Gloucestershire CCG

title: Clean, efficient
body: Quick appointment - the area of SpaMedica is spotless and the staff friendly and professional.   Didn't have to wait long so all done in no time

author: Vik23
title: Its good to see teamwork and happy, helpful staff
body:
My 4 year old son attended today for adenotonsillectomy under the care of Mr Simpson and registrar Gio.  
From the moment we arrived we were kept fully informed of everything that was going to happen and rationale provided. All the nurses were knowledable, friendly and upbeat. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble and they were very attentive.  
Mr Simpson and Gio were very warm and communicated well with myself and my husband.  
Anaesthetist Dr? Dunn was very thorough and had a lovely manner with my son.  
I went into theatre with him to be anaesthetised and even the staff in there were very sensitive towards me and really put us both at our ease.  
Discharge information and emergency advice given clearly and concisely and throughout our entire day there I can't fault anyone.  
I'm a charge nurse although I never said but it's good to see great team work and happy, helpful staff doing a great job. There aren't many good NHS stories so it's important to give credit where it's due.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: Buzz
title: Huge delay in tests in eye clinic
body:
Forgotten, abandoned, age discrimination, had they lost the request.  
I went to the eye clinic in June last year, the clinician wanted another test done but this could not be done on the day. It was thought I would be sent an appointment for this in a few weeks, which to me seemed acceptable .  
Now months later I have received the test appointment for April this year. This long wait is unacceptable. I was told by a member of staff last time I went to the clinic they they felt that patients were being 'encouraged' to go privately by such long waiting times in this eye clinic.  
It is simply bad practice, eyes are so important, patients could lose their sight or sight deteriorate badly during these long delays. We all know that the NHS money has been cut during the last 10 years by this government and this is just one, of many I guess, results of these cuts.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Zyx
title: Eyes!
body:
After years of prevarication by opticians I got referred for cataracts operations.  
First op after a few weeks. Excellent results and minimal pain.  
Same for the second op. Eyesight now as good as it had ever been.  
Around three years later had wet macular degeneration in one eye, diagnosed at Bristol and treated by injection at Weston.  
Again, excelent treatment with positive results.  
Injection in right eye on-going on a six weekly basis.  
Horrible as injection in the eye sounds, it can be described as uncomfortable, never painful.  
Again, excellent service at all levels from the staff here.

readBy.name: NHS Bristol, North Somerset and South Gloucestershire CCG

author: Kellz
title: My stay in hospital
body:
Pilgrim hospital  
Complaints  
1. Took them a hour to bring me a commode so had to improvise and squat to urinate  
2. Hardly fed at lunch-wasn't given proper meal or desert  
3. Staff talking to me like shit-didnt like any of the menu so asked for alternatives got told "there isn't any"  
4. They are taking over 2 and 45mins to empty my comode it was left that long there was a hole in the pot

title: Great care
body: I have not had any trouble making a telephone appointment since the phone queue system was introduced so I am surprised at the issues people have had. I find the receptionists very nice and efficient. When I call up I have always been called back promptly by my usual GP who is very nice and professional, and is one of the senior doctors at the practice. This is super helpful as often phone advice is sufficient and I work so this avoids unnecessary time off for a face to face appointment. Most of my calls have been about my kids and for some time I have always been called back by the same GP, and I feel better for having that continuity though understand it might not always be possible. Whenever she has said something just needs watching rather than antibiotics, and to call back if it gets worse, she has been right. Today I called about my son and she offered us an appointment to come in straight away to examine him. She had a great manner with him and saw he needed antibiotics and quickly prescribed them, gave me info about why it had likely happened and what to look out for in future. I’m really happy with the care we got today and for the last few years. I have no trouble recommending this practice.

title: Fabulous Staff
body:
I am writing to pass on my praise and to commend your staff and operations.

On 14th February 2020 my mother was brought to the Emergency Department in an ambulance having collapsed whilst playing badminton. 

At every stage of her treatment the staff were friendly, respectful, and explained what was happening and what would happen next. The Advanced Nurse Practitioner, in particular, impressed us with her detailed questioning to establish what had been happening with my mum’s recent health in order to build a complete picture. 

Blood tests were completed within an hour. Mum stabilised quite quickly and a revised prescription for medication arranged and obtained promptly together with a discharge letter for her GP. 

I would ask that you pass on our thanks and praise to your staff.

readBy.name: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic hospital, excellent care and wonderful…
body: First of all, after reading some of the reviews on this website, there are some patients out there that need to remember this is a HOSPITAL and NOT a hotel! ...The Meriden is bright, clean, modern and airy, and has a calm, relaxed atmosphere. Rooms are very well sized and clean with lovely en suite wet room. Relaxed visiting hours is much more convenient and visitors were made welcome by staff. My surgery was well explained, well done with no complications. The aftercare, communication and pain management I received was excellent, with my medical information obviously passed on meticulously at shift changes. Every single member of staff that I encountered was very friendly, courteous, relaxed and professional- it's obvious staff enjoy working here. The hospital has a constant 'air' of calm competence that relaxes you as soon as you walk in. Nothing is too much trouble. Everyone wants your hospital stay to be as pleasant as possible. I would thoroughly recommend the BMI Meriden for any treatment.

author: Demicheffnaz
title: All the staff that looked after me
body:
I first arrived at this hospital on Monday with my wife to A@E thinking I was going to spend some hours and leave but it ended up after the x-ray I had to stay the night as the operation was the next day Tuesday.  
I was first to go all the staff prepared me beforehand explained everything. I want to thank everyone I'm still in my ward tbh I don't know when I will leave please tell Victor he has been working in this hospital for 17 years tell him thank you very much and there are those that I don't remember names but all are female staff that where working day/night staff please tell them a big thank you  
Kind regards

author: Danmz93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: It is really beneficial
body:
MBAR course is really helpful. I am in week three and the teacher is warm, kind and passionate.  
We have 6-8 of us on the course and everyone is learning and sharing their dependency challenges & successes.  
We all agree that this course is helping with relapse prevention.  
It is really beneficial and crucial that our teacher has been on similar journey so she can empathise with us.  
Mel is fantastic!

author: Danmz93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Looking forward to the attend the whole course
body:
MBAR  
Lovely group. I feel happy and looking forward to the attend the whole course.

title: Don’t answer the phones
body: Made a call to book an appointment at 8am 22 minutes later the phones are still engaged over 200 times I tried to ring

author: Lexi1
title: Exceptional care
body:
After a complex history of trying for our beautiful baby boy we are now in the position to thank all the staff who helped us finally get our family. From start to finish, from the doctors to the HCSWs we have had exceptional very individualised care.  
Please excuse the list of names but we wish people to know how much they helped us. The care we received from Dr Shetty was truly incredible, we cannot thank her enough. She is a credit to her profession and the hospital. Myra is a very special person doing a very difficult job.Fiona’s support and words helped us though very difficult times.  
Out-patient department staff who knew me by name.  
All the theatre staff, I wish I could remember all your names but I was slightly overwhelmed at the time. You are all amazing, kind and considerate.  
Dr Hendrie who kept me calm and reassured me throughout, that meant a lot.  
The recovery midwifes who looked after us and showed great patience with us.  
The staff on Ashgrove ward who gave us care when needed and space when that was required too.  
Thank you all.

author: ij
title: parathyroid operation
body:
Would like to thank Mr, Ratliff and staff nurse Kev and his team for the fantastic treatment I received recently.  
Everybody was very attentive nothing was to much trouble, special thanks to Habiba for her kindness.

title: Poor phone service and parking.
body: I have had this issue before. Trying to make an emergency appointment is impossible over the phone. Loads numbers no help at all. Have to go in person, parking is a nightmare., whole thing is a shambles. Web site doesn't work for apointment gives 404 and 500 errors.

title: Amazing care
body: I needed to see a GP at the Walk in Centre. Whilst waiting, I asked the receptionist if it was ok to breastfeed my 7 week old baby. The receptionist immediately offered to find me a private room, offered me a glass of water and made me feel so comfortable and well looked after. All the staff I came into contact with were friendly and welcoming. Very impressed. Thank you.

author: Jayboy
title: Cleaners to Consultants, heroes all
body:
My 3 yr old was treated at A and E at johns having trapped her finger in a door hinge, then operated on a couple of days later at sick kids Edinburgh.  
It was Friday night at bed time. After screams, tears, some first aid and a hurriedly cancelled sleepover, we arrived at A and E at 915 with upset Mum (she’d closed the door) and a worried 9yr old sister.  
We left 2 hrs later having been triaged, cleaned up, x-rayed, seen by a doctor, plastic surgeon, beautifully bandaged and got organised for an operation in a couple of days.  
Everyone was kind, caring, skilled and, whilst obviously focusing on the patient, they also looked out for the rest of us.  
It was a wonderful example of the NHS, free at the point of need, when needed most.  
That was the Friday evening, Monday morning we arrive at Sick Kids way too early after a surprisingly successful attempt to miss the traffic - 715am.  
Again, all staff were caring, thoughtful and engaged wonderfully with her. There wasn’t a flicker of concern about our early arrival and my daughter was supported to tell her story and was fully involved and listened to (even down to remembering she liked her butter to be melted into her toast!). We brought her older sister, not realising siblings can’t be on the ward, which meant we tag teamed back and forth and she occasionally waited on the seats outside the ward for a few minutes whilst passing staff offered her toys and books.  
I could wax lyrical about the skills of each person we met, but they were all excellent. One of the things that struck me was how children of similar ages and going through similar experiences were subtly grouped around the ward and in terms of their list place - this created additional support between patients and parents - good move.  
So, thank you all, Cleaners to Consultants, hero’s all.

title: Good practice
body:
The service I recieved was excellent. I spoke to office staff and was very understanding & booked  me appointment within few days.
When I arrived at surgery I was feeling nervous and anxious. The staff made me feel comfortable by showing empathy, friendly, caring and warmth.
Overall very happy with the sevice I received and I feel  was treated an dealt  with a very thorough, kind and professional manner everyone from the receptionist to the GP.
Special thankyou to office staff who went the extra mile☺

author: J C B
title: Infant feeding support worker service
body:
When I had my baby in October 2019 at Raigmore Hospital in Inverness, my baby wouldn’t latch on. The amount of infant feeding support I received at both at the hospital and afterwards was phenomenal.  
The infant feeding support workers really made it possible for me to breastfeed my baby (which will be far more beneficial for the baby) in a difficult situation. I wouldn’t have managed without the infant feeding support workers.  
Once I got home, Daoine came to my house several times to help me use the nipple shields, which turned out to be the only way my daughter could get a latch. Subsequently I have enjoyed going to Daoine’s Feeding Support Group in Dingwall to meet other breastfeeding mums and exchange advice. I have tried other baby/toddler groups, and Daoine’s Feeding Support Group is the best.

readBy.name: Office of Rhoda Grant, MSP for Highlands and Islands

author: m2345
title: Still getting nowhere
body:
Last 2 appointments cancelled the day before by text, lovely how they tell us by 3 texts that each appointment costs £160 if a no show occurs !!  
Now almost to the day its been 2 years since my pain started and still getting nowhere, each appointment months away. Now ive not been given a new appointment despite leaving 2 messages because nobody answers the phone !!!!

title: Lovely people awful access
body:
Sorry but your access is becoming less and less fit for purpose from a patient perspective. Our latest record is pressing redial 140 times but I have friends that can beat that. When you do eventually get through you are left on hold for up to 10mins and there doesn’t seem to be any attempt at maintaining continuity with clinicians. 
Apathy has so far stopped us changing GP but if things don’t change we will and I suspect others too. 
Please consider reviewing your system. There are some excellent digital options out there (I’m not convinced about Doctorlink but would happily tell you about askmyGP)

author: Mummyofalittlemonkeyortwo
title: Mixed experience over the past 3 years
body:
I have had mixed experience with my local hospital. My daughter had group b strep pneumonia and bacteria in her spinal fluid at 11 hours old. I felt they focused on my weight so much in my pregnancy that some things I.e the Group b strep would have been more important to look out for. But my labour and aftercare for myself and daughter was excellent on that account.  
My next experience was with my son. Labour ward staff were amazing. But after birth because they were moving hospitals the care for me and baby was bad. No help to breastfeed they were too busy with a skeleton staff. My son was accident cannulated and given antibiotics at 3 days old. After a number of precautions had already been taken. They did come and remove it 40 mins later. And the head off department apologised. I believe a midwife made a complaint for me.  
After that my son developed RSV bronculitis at 7 days old. And honestly the doctors were amazing. A whole 10 days in hospital and we were treated well. A few problems I.e no help to breastfeed after my son came of cpap oxygen and having to wait a really long time with a screaming newborn waiting on the tube feed to come. It was hard to get any food or breaks for myself to eat as my family were all elsewhere allot of the time.  
We went home after a crazy week and I was very traumatised by it wall. And found that I wish someone had taken some time to talk with me about what happened. As I did not remember it all.. then I spent the next 6 monthes battling with my GPs because my son has asthma like symptoms but no one would listen until we ended up back in A&E and needing Oxygen. Then finally we got what we needed to help him.  
When it comes to his peadiatric visits now the doctors are nice and caring. But the letters always have something wrong in them. Wither something missing or something is said the wrong way.  
The only other thing is my daughter has two swollen glands and they have been this way for years. I have been several times to have them checked and it still worries me that just looking is not enough. I wish my GP practice would do more in that way. And not make me feel like a paranoid individual. Even going into appointments and the doctor has no idea about my child's history. I think they maybe have a glance before you walk in?  
I have also walked into an appointment made 3 weeks in advance. Told the doctor the problem and they have just said that is a health visitor problem...but mu experiences with most professionals is good.

author: Janeth
title: What a brilliant service
body: While visiting my mum in hospital, I thought I’d call in to audiology for some new batteries for my hearing aids. I mentioned to the receptionist Debbie that I wasn’t hearing as well as I did. She asked me to wait one moment and returned with Lee who checked my ears, changed and shortened the tubes of my aids and 10 minutes later I my hearing is so much better. What brilliant service. Thank you

readBy.name: Taunton and Somerset NHS Foundation Trust

author: Smf9
title: Emergency surgery
body:
I was admitted through ED at Glasgow Royal Infirmary last week. I have never in my life used this service before and what a 1st experience. I was was given the very best of care and attention quickly with compassion and understanding. I was then transferred to ward 61 to await theatre . All the staff were professional, friendly and above all kind. All grades of staff should be appreciated the porters that took me to theatre with a cheery smile and helped husband to get out of building. The nursing staff that were working under enormous pressure but still made me feel important to them. There was a few who stood out and I will thank them personally later but everyone was working hard. The physio and ot who made it possible for me to get home safely The theatre staff who made it possible for me to get to theatre on the day of my admission. The medical staff who used their skills and expertise  
There are so many people to mention for 1 short stay that it amazes me but each and everyone should be proud of the job they do. So thank you 😊

title: Fantastic care
body:
I was diagnosed with breast cancer and attended two outpatient appointments before receiving surgery in February 2020. All staff in the breast unit were extremely caring, empathetic and kind. They explained clearly what needed to be done and their, kindness, good practice and care took away all my fears.
Thank you so much for your care. I can highly recommend MK Brest care unit.

readBy.name: Milton Keynes University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: great practice
body: would give 10/10 for online training always been a first class practice great doctors and treatment.

title: Wonderful Professional Staff
body:
Ward 4  Trauma & Orthopaedics

I recently had a shoulder arthroscopy & decompression
The nursing staff made me feel confident and relaxed and couldn’t do enough to make the procedure so smoothly.
My surgeon and staff were also first class.
Thank you all including the gentleman that wheeled me down to the operating theatre .

title: Minor Operation
body:
After visiting Beech House  Surgery today for a minor operation, the staff were lovely very professional made me feel very relaxed and very friendly , excellent patient service and 
made me feel completely comfortable with the procedure. I did feel a thing and they definitely deserved a great patient feedback mention from myself.
No problems making the appointment with the doctor and followed up with second procedure all well and good.
The receptionist was very professional friendly and helpful with booking my next review appointment and can I also mention Anthony I think he works doing administrative work in the surgery 
 is a credit to Beach House remains professional & calm under pressure when dealing with patients which I have also experienced on one  occasion when I witnessed a very rude patient trying to make an appointment on the day when the surgery was completely full as he was totally unshaken by the lady manner keeping a cool professional manner and offering the best advice for another day and time to suit ,he was filling in on the front reception well done, a couple of months ago. Also all the doctors I personally seen at Beech House are a credit plus the nurse too. Its a very busy doctors practice although the always try hard to , accommodate short notice Emergency appointments on the day if you telephone at 8.00 am

title: Ear Ear
body: I suffer from continuing wax build up in my right ear. Sunday 1st Match I put olive oil Otex in both ears. Monday the 2nd I got the tissue paper out of left, but couldn't reach the paper in the right. I went to DMH Urgent Care the nurse examined me  and attempted the pull the tissue out. He couldn't reach it and referred me to ENT the Doctor's examination and the retrial of the tissue was swift and painless. They then syringed both ears. Fantastic I fitted both my earring aids, I could hear a pin drop from 50 yards. Fantastic service and very skilled nurses and Doctor's.

author: zulusj83
title: Lack of support
body:
I was recently discharged from Hairmyres hospital ward 4 after being admitted with abdominal pain and spent 2 nights in hospital. Medically with regards to investigations I cannot fault the team at all. They have been very thorough in trying to find out what was wrong with me. However i feel that I need to provide feedback with regards to the lack of support I received as a breast feeding mother.  
They prescribed me oramorph to manage my pain while I was admitted, which took the edge off but I was still In a lot of pain. At time of discharge I was and still am in significant pain and weary about how I was going to manage my pain at home and continue breastfeeding. Being in close contact with my daughter who needs the comfort and security of breastfeeding, I needed to ensure it was safe for me to feed her. While I was in hospital I had no choice not to feed my daughter temporarily, and continuously voiced my concerns to medical staff about my need to continue breast feeding when I go home. My daughter was brought to see me while I was in hospital and had to be taken away after 5 minutes as she was so distressed at not being allowed to nurse from me.  
When I was told I was being discharged to come back as an outpatient for endoscopy, I told them I was worried about how I was going to cope with pain and that I need something to allow me to breastfeed as my daughter will get distressed if I’m there and she cannot nurse and this would be distressing for me too. So they said they would get the pain nurse to come and see me.  
The pain nurse seen me very briefly , and advised I would be sent home with cocodamol. I have been told that breastfeeding mothers definitely can’t take cocodamol so I said that I couldn’t take cocodamol. I was told I would just need to stop breastfeeding to manage my pain. I asked if they could give me dihydrocodeine instead, and had to argue my case that cocodamol made me feel sick and i have tolerated dihydrocodeine in the past, as any time I mentioned breastfeeding I was made to feel like I had no choice but to stop. Even when I said I was prescribed dihydrocodeine when my baby was first born, they wouldn't change from cocodamol. But did once I told them I couldn’t tolerate it and needed adequate pain relief, then the prescription was changed. So I was discharged with dihydrocodeine but was told I was not allowed to continue breastfeeding. I insisted this isn’t something I want to do, but was told that I would need to stop. They did say that she would go and find out about dihydrocodeine when breastfeeding and get back to me after I asked to look into it before I go. But they never came back. The Ward nurse came with my discharge meds and i asked if I could breastfeed and was again told no.  
I had to go home and endure my daughter screaming and distressed because I was at home and she couldn’t nurse from me when she obviously needed this nurturing after missing me while I was in hospital. When the comfort of my breast is all she has known when she is upset since she was born. I had to hide from her in the bedroom and was very upset myself. I spent the whole night in agony as I felt I couldn’t take any pain relief until I know I am safely able to breastfeed my baby. As stopping for us simply is not an option.  
When I woke up this morning I called the infant feeding team at Wishaw general for advice on taking medication. I couldn’t call before as it was out of hours. They spoke to the pharmacist for me to see if the morphine from yesterday would be out of my system and and advised me that I can in fact continue breastfeeding while taking dihydrocodeine and I was right in refusing cocodamol while breastfeeding . I feel that I was rushed out the door with lack of knowledge and support to protect the infant mother breastfeeding relationship and no concern about the emotional stress this would cause for my baby and for myself with pain and feeling unwell on top of it. My breastfeeding did not feel like a priority to medical staff despite me continuously expressing how much a priority it was to me throughout my admission.  
I was moved to a communal room with other patients and closed my curtains so I had privacy to express. I can’t use an electric pump anyway so have little suction cups to catch letdown and I need to hand express. And because I was away from my baby for so long and on morphine and nil by mouth I had to wear these continuously and try and stimulate milk production in order to maintain a supply for when I was discharged, there was a man in the bed next to mine and lots visitors at the other beds throughout the day. So I wasn’t comfortable having the curtains open to express. I wasn’t comfortable even with them closed and found it hard to relax to express which is an important factor as well. But I had no control over that. All I could do was close the curtains. But on several occasions, staff would walk in and out and try to open the curtains and I had to repeatedly show them what I was doing for them to close them again. I found it humiliating having to repeatedly justify why I needed privacy and especially humiliating that everyone in the room knew what I was doing as they heard me having to explain time and time again. I’m a very private person and having people hear and know that I'm am sitting behind a curtain with my boobs out trying to stimulate them to produce milk is mortifying and I found it quite distressing. At one point i overheard two staff members outside the room talking about me and I felt it was in a judgemental tone. One asked why I was not opening the curtains and the other said that I was expressing, the first then asked why I was doing that, and the other replied “god knows”.Any time a clinical support came in for something I felt as though they were ignorant towards me and annoyed at me for not having the curtains open. Although they didn’t say anything, I felt that the way way they interacted with me was cold and I felt as though I was doing something to annoy them. In the end I just looked away and never made eye contact with them. Breastfeeding is a huge thing to me as a mother and to my daughter who is thriving having the nurturing and health benefits of breast milk. The world health organisation recommends breastfeeding to age 2 and beyond. There are lots of health benefits to the mother as well. And I especially feel this as it helps my chronic health condition of fibromyalgia and my mental health problems depression and anxiety. It helps me get a deep level of restorative sleep that lacks in fibromyalgia sufferers, and I was greatly affected by not having this restful sleep before breastfeeding which really affected my ability to function day to day. It also helps boost serotonin and oxytocin levels to regulate my depression and anxiety and avoid going back on medication for it while my baby is so young. So it’s not just a case of stopping breastfeeding, it’s the impact it will have on many aspects of me and my daughters well-being.  
The reason I felt I needed to express my opinion is I feel that more knowledge and understanding of breastfeeding within the department is clearly needed. I feel as health professionals you should be able to support breastfeeding as much as possible. Even just knowing to contact the infant support team for advice, who have access to pharmacists who have in depth knowledge about medication and breastfeeding would be a start. I could have been discharged with a plan to support my breastfeeding and control my pain instead of being told to stop breastfeeding due to a lack of knowledge. The resources are available to you within NHS Lanarkshire and for a breastfeeding mother to be discharged with little regard to the importance of breastfeeding I find it deeply concerning. Especially after such a distressing night of pain and a distressed upset baby which could have been completely avoided.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Atrocious service
body: Had trouble with this service last year- cancelled appts at short notice, unable to complain, a complete barrier to accessing the knee replacement I need. To my dismay was referred back to them for arthritis in my hand to be agreed I need a steroid injection. Physio was supposed to refer me. Haven’t heard anything other  than a discharge letter the day after. Now no-one knows what’s going on. Absolutely appalling.

title: Excellent practice
body: I am very happy with the care I received at Willow Wood Surgery, from my experience in booking my appointment to the care I received from my GP.

title: Very good service
body: The plasters dept were really excellent. The member of staff who dealt with my 92 year old mother put a new plaster on her severely fractured wrist with expertise and humour and made the rather painful procedure so much better for her. Many thanks.

title: Apawling service
body:
Son booked in for surgery
Told to be here for 7.30am 
Arrived  booked in at gate 40 waited the aneathatist came and said I need to check his ultrasound scan 2 hours later told to go and have another scan
Informed the nurses that he needs an injection at 12.15 it is now 1.30 and still waiting.
Nice clean hospital 
Shame about the communication skills.
Will definitely not recommend pinderfields 
And the car parking can only be described  as a very unfunny joke and a expence on the sick and poor

title: Great kindness
body: A Whipps cross postman saw that I was struggling with the hospital wheelchair as I was wheeling my 92 year old mother trying to find my way to the Xray dept. He came to my aid as he knew his way round. Not only did he push the chair but said that he would come back and take us back to the orthopedic dept. So kind of him. We were very touched. So many thanks indeed.

title: Really rude
body: The receptionist are very rude. I am extremely disappointed with the service. The doctors are nice and professional.

title: Put my mind at rest
body: I have been under the care of this surgery for the past few months and the care I have received has been second to none.  A query was clarified quickly and my mind put at rest.  I am very happy that I am with this surgery with such forward and positive thinking members of staff.

title: They didn't even bother
body: Firstly, I just want to say I had to ring them 79 times in order for my call to go through, because the phones weren't turned on until 20 past 8 the day I called. I was told to get my ear syringed. I spoke to the receptionist at the time and was told I could get it done two days later, but I wanted to get back to work ASAP so I decided to call in the morning to see if there were cancellations. I call this morning to be told that ear syringing is ONLY DONE on Mondays, and the next appointment was nearly 3 weeks away. They then said they could check another practice to see if they had anything available. Maybe 20 seconds later they tell me no. I call this same practice and they DO have an appointment available in 3 days for this to be done. Unfortunately, I needed THIS practice to call them in order to get this appointment. Obviously that wasn't going to happen, and obviously the person I spoke to this morning didn't actually check with this practice like they said they did. I'm now going to the walk in because I don't even need an appointment to get it done there, and I much rather wait a couple hours to get it done than three whole weeks. Horrendous service.

author: whisperjz38
title: I don't know where I'd be without these resources
body:
Tracey has been absolutely amazing.  
She has supported our family when we didn't know where to turn for help. The strategies she has delivered have helped our family significantly.  
The courses and resources available from the Ravensdale Childrens Centre are wonderful and don't know where I'd be in my parenting journey without them. The staff are second to none.

title: Great service provided
body: I visited this surgery today. I had a little wait for the doctor, but what excellent service provided. The doctor took interest in what I was saying, he made me feel completely at ease. Lovely staff on the reception desk, such a friendly team.

author: bracecw54
title: I get help and support
body:
168 Group -  
Michelle, Sian & Paddy run the group. I get help & support from the group and ideas to organise my week.  
EBI Group -  
Support & Help.  
NA -  
Michelle signposted me to NA. 1 meeting in and I've met people in the same position as me.  
Michelle is my keyworker - she is a nice helpful, woman. I feel comfortable talking to her and she is a good listener.

author: tigersk65
title: Friendly staff
body:
Very good staff  
Nice and friendly

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: greengr65
title: Brilliant experience
body: experience was brilliant

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: capellasy94
title: He never judges me
body: Without the help of my keyworker I don't know where I'd be, he never judges me just he encourages me to keep trying. I look forward to each session.

author: octobersf47
title: I have found the group helpful
body:
I currently take part in the Art group with Diane. I have found it to be very helpful in me being able to remain absinate. I look forward every week to coming to the group and meeting the regulars and also to meeting the new members.  
I also work with Michelle and Sian and Paddy in the 168 group. I have so far found the group to be helpful in giving me the tools to becoming more organised with my time. I'm very grateful to Sian for encouraging me to give the group a try. Michelle also mentioned the art group to me for which I am also very grateful. I feel positive about my future when I have people such as Diane, Michelle, Sian, Paddy and all the people I work with within the CGL Community. Thank you everybody.

title: Friendly and efficient practice
body:
I have been with the practice for over 5 years now ever since I moved to Stalybridge. All staff have always been very friendly and do their best to help.
Recently I took my newborn baby there for her vaccinations and all three injections were done with care and patience. I cannot recommend them highly enough.

author: leobt35
title: Always helpful
body:
CGL Meeting people with same conditions and learning ways to move forward with the right help Louise Michelle and Mel from Act Jamie and Mark. Michael + Laura/  
168 Helping me to change habits and break the same behaviour and start to make plans .  
Paddy Sian Michelle  
Key Worker Jo. Always helpful

author: ophiuchusfb54
title: My experience coming to CGL
body:
My experience coming to CGL  
Michelle, Paddy, Sian I want to give a good thank you too.  
Learning about how to overcome my addiction. Confidence building, Accertioness filling in a timetable each week giving myself things to do each day. And setting up a college at CGL

author: cetusrd69
title: I am heading in the right direction
body:
I have been using 168 meetings for a while with the support of Michelle, Paddy & Sian.  
I feel this service to be of a big advantage in my life.  
With the best support ever from this group I feel that I am heading in the right direction for my recovery.

author: Maybelle
title: Outstanding support provided by OT
body:
As pupil support co-ordinator in a Primary School in Ayrshire it is my job to ensure that the children in our school receive the right help at the right time.  
In our experience the professionals from the UK Health and Care Services who come in to school to work with our children build a great relationship with the pupils and their families. They help to improve outcomes for our young people and support our whole school community to be the best that we can be.  
We enjoy excellent relationships H & C S colleagues and feel that communication is a strength. As well as attending meetings, they are always happy to answer a question or signpost us to helpful information.  
It is a pleasure to work in partnership with other agencies in order to have a positive impact on the lives of young people.  
Thank you for all that you do.

title: Outstanding care home
body: This is an outstanding care home (and I have seen many in my professional capacity). From the moment my mother arrived she was treated with respect, dignity and above all kindness and tenderness. In the twenty months that she lived at Antokol, I never witnessed any of the staff treat any of the residents with anything less than gentleness and attentiveness, despite the fact that some of the residents have dementia. The residents are treated as individuals and activities are tailored to their particular needs. There is an atmosphere of calm efficiency fostered by the excellent leadership of the manager. The home has mainly Polish residents but the English residents and their families were equally happy with the care and had chosen the home for its caring ethos. In the last days of my mother's life the staff treated my mother and us with exceptional solicitude and care and we could not have hoped for a better place for her to end her days.

title: Receptionist very dismissive
body: One of the receptionists is very dismissive when trying to explain, doesn’t let you finish before interrupting and very unhelpful. All of the other receptionists are lovely and always very helpful.

author: chippypip
title: Hand surgery
body:
Admitted for hand surgery at the end of Feb. From the moment I walked in the door the experience was nothing but friendly, calm and positive the young lady on reception was extremely pleasant and helpful and it was only 7-05am at 7-15 all patients in the waiting area were taken upstairs to the main reception area and then to their corresponding bays,  
Once in the correct bay I was introduced to the person in charge of my care, and also seen by the consultant in charge of my procedure Mrs Dunlop all details of my procedure were then checked and double checked.  
Once I had been taken to theater everything was checked again by the anaesthetist and the whole procedure explained in detail.  
Once admitted to the main theater area all markings and details were checked again the atmosphere was very relaxed and professional ,all went well with the surgery and after a nice cup of tea I was able to go home already issued with an outpatient appointment for the following Friday for a change of dressing.  
all in all I can only say a very big thank you for the service that I have received we so often hear the moans about the N.H.S but seldom hear the good or positive.  
Many thanks to all concerned keep up the good work.

title: Poor communication
body: I have been waiting for an email to be actioned with a new prescription medication that Sandlwood court prescribed on monday. When I phoned the surgery this morning I was told the script was ready for collection straight away so I booked a taxi to the surgery. On arrival the receptionist couldn't find the prescription I explained that I was told it was and to collect. I was then told it hadn't been sorted with the dr so I'd have to come back later. I wasted £12 in taxis and I'm disabled so returning later want an option I was not prepared to pay another £12....the receptionist then agreed that once the dr had sorted the script it would be delivered to my address but I dont know when this will be.. I'm really not happy with the lack of communication my time and money was wasted and I still dont have my medication.
